author: Tim Reardon
title: Pet-friendly Halloween events around Philadelphia
text:
Entertainment Pet-friendly Halloween events around Philadelphia Halloween is fun for all, especially your pets. This is the only time of the year where animals of all shapes and sizes get dressed up in adorable, and sometimes even scary, costumes. Pet-friendly Halloween events around Philadelphia The Philadelphia Welfare Society's annual Mutt Strut returns on Saturday, Oct. 24 Katie McMenamin Travel Deals Tim Reardon Posted: Wednesday, October 21, 2015, 4:44 PM 
Face it, Halloween is fun for all, especially your pets. This is the only time of the year where animals of all shapes and sizes get dressed up in adorable, and sometimes even scary, costumes. 
If you think your furry pal’s costume is “100 pawcent,” dazzle them up and visit these pet-friendly events. East Falls’ newest animal boutique Pet Street will get in the Halloween spirit on Saturday, Oct. 24 with a costume contest and parade at the neighborhood’s Inn Yard Park (Ridge Avenue and Stanton Street). From noon to 5 p.m., dress up your pooches and enter them to win prizes, media coverage, and wagging rights. If you just so happen to be in Delaware, PAWS for People’s annual Wag-n-Walk 5K run returns on Saturday, Oct. 24 . Taking place at Delcastle Recreation Center (710 McKennans Church Road), this new location provides more space for runners, as well as pets. Things kick off at 8 a.m. and animals (and their owners) are encouraged to dress in costume. 
Doggies galore will take over the Navy Yard (4747 S. Broad St.) for the Philadelphia Animal Welfare Society’s 9th annual Mutt Strut . This yearly tradition hosts hundreds of dogs with their caretakers, as well as animals up for adoption. If you don’t have a furry friend to walk, no worries. You can lend a hand with PAWS’ current housed hounds. The strut starts at 9 a.m. and registration is here . If you think your pet dons the best Halloween attire, he or she can win prizes at Unleashed by Petco (1939 Callowhill St.) during a spooky costume contest . Things kick off on Saturday, Oct. 24 at 2 p.m., and 1st place gets a $50 storewide gift card. Prizes for 2nd and 3rd will be given, too. 
Smile! Does your pet look stunning in Halloween gear? If so, capture the moment with adorable portrait shots on Sunday, Oct. 25 at BONeJOUR Pet Boutique (53 N. 3rd St.). Photos take place from 1 to 3 p.m. Call 215-574-1225 for more information. On Saturday, Oct. 31, the Pennsylvania SPCA celebrates the holiday with a Howl-o-Ween extravaganza. Taking place at the Erie Avenue location (350 East Erie Ave.), guests will have the chance to hang out with adoptable in-costume animals, take part in spooky art and crafts, and go on scavenger hunts for treats. In addition to the party, all PSPCA locations will run a discounted adoption price for selected pets at each center. The event gets started at noonFor more Things to Do, check out our calendar for the most up-to-date happenings.
